Jakarta Setara Ala Anies Baswedan
04 Nov 2019, 05:18 by Rakhmad Hidayatulloh Permana
Jakarta - Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan bicara tentang prinsip 'Jakarta setara'. Komitmen Anies soal prinsip tersebut disampaikan ketika dia menjelaskan soal pembagian zona berdagang untuk PKL saat car free day (CFD).
"Nah, saya ingin sampaikan apresiasi terima kasih kepada PKL yang mereka mau mengikuti apa yang kita atur. Prinsipnya selalu kita sampaikan, Jakarta itu setara, kesempatannya diberikan, tapi bukan tanpa diatur," kata Anies di kawasan Bundaran HI, Jalan MH Thamrin, Jakarta Pusat, Minggu (3/11/2019).
Anies pun meluruskan maksud dari penentuan zona larangan berdagang PKL. Dia menegaskan bahwa apa yang dilakukan ini bukanlah penertiban, melainkan penataan. Menurutnya, penataan merupakan tujuan utama dari CFD.
"Jadi yang kita lakukan sekarang ini bukan penertiban. Sesungguhnya yang dilakukan adalah penataan seperti tujuan utama diadakan car free day," ungkapnya.
Selain itu, Anies mengatakan, dengan adanya pengaturan ini, para PKL pun akhirnya bisa mendapatkan rezeki. Rezeki itu diperoleh dari orang-orang yang sedang berolahraga di kawasan CFD.
"Begitu diatur baik-baik, Alhamdulillah, mereka pun dapat kesempatan mendapat rezeki dari begitu banyaknya orang di sisi lain yang berolahraga nyaman," tutur Anies.
Anies mengenang situasi PKL yang tertata di CFD ini seperti masa tahun 2001. Ketika itu, lanjut Anies, CFD memang dimaksudkan untuk mengurangi polusi emisi udara.
"Jadi begini, ketika kegiatan CFD dimulai tahun 2001 pada waktu itu memang digunakan untuk salah satu kegiatan pengurangan polusi emisi udara. Yang kedua untuk kegiatan berolahraga berjalan, bersepeda," kenang Anies.
Anies lantas menjelaskan zona-zona penataan PKL itu. Dia membeberkan soal kawasan zona merah bagi PKL.
"Lalu ada kawasan yang trotoarnya bisa digunakan untuk berdagang dan ada yang tidak bisa untuk berdagang. Nah, ada istilahnya zona merah, zona merah itu adalah kawasan Jalan Thamrin di persimpangan Sarinah sampai dengan dekat Dukuh Atas itu adalah kawasan yang baik badan jalan dan trotoarnya tidak dibolehkan kegiatan untuk berdagang," jelas Anies.

Jakarta Equivalent Ala Anies Baswedan
Nov 04 2019, 05:18 by Rakhmad Hidayatulloh Permana
Jakarta - DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan talked about the principle of 'equal Jakarta'. Anies's commitment to the principle was conveyed when she explained the matter of the division of trading zones for street vendors on car free day (CFD).
"Well, I want to express my gratitude to the street vendors that they want to follow what we set. We always convey the principle, Jakarta is equal, the opportunity is given, but not without regulation," said Anies in the HI Roundabout area, Jalan MH Thamrin, Jakarta Center, Sunday (3/11/2019).
Anies also straightened the intention of determining the no-trade zone of street vendors. He stressed that what was done was not order, but arrangement. According to him, structuring is the main objective of the CFD.
"So what we are doing now is not controlling. In fact what is being done is structuring as the main goal is to hold a car free day," he said.
In addition, Anies said, with this arrangement, the street vendors were finally able to get a fortune. Sustenance was obtained from people who were exercising in the CFD area.
"Once it is set up well, Alhamdulillah, they also get the chance to get fortune from so many people on the other side who exercise comfortably," Anies said.
Anies recalled the situation of street vendors arranged in this CFD as in 2001. At that time, continued Anies, CFD was intended to reduce air emissions pollution.
"So, like this, when the CFD activities started in 2001 at that time it was indeed used for one of the activities in reducing air pollution emissions. The second was for running, cycling," Anies recalled.
Anies then explained the zones structuring the street vendors. He revealed the matter of the red zone area for street vendors.
"Then there are areas where the sidewalks can be used for trading and there are those who cannot trade. Now, there is a term called the red zone, the red zone is the Thamrin Street area at the Sarinah crossing to near the Upper Hamlet. "trading activities are permitted," Anies explained.
